<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> class tracks the information need to locate where a callee saved register is in the current frame. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> class tracks the information need to locate where a callee saved register is in the current frame.

Callee saved reg can also be saved to a different register rather than on the stack by setting DstReg instead of FrameIdx.

Definition at line 34 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineframeinfo-h">MachineFrameInfo.h</a>.

### Restored {#addb95c6f3adcf9e7fe7b207de38e69ff}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::CalleeSavedInfo::Restored = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a></>}>
Flag indicating whether the register is actually restored in the epilog.

In most cases, if a register is saved, it is also restored. There are some situations, though, when this is not the case. For example, the LR register on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a> is usually saved, but on exit from the function its saved value may be loaded directly into PC. Since liveness tracking of physical registers treats callee-saved registers are live outside of the function, LR would be treated as live-on-exit, even though in these scenarios it is not. This flag is added to indicate that the saved register described by this object is not restored in the epilog. The long-term solution is to model the liveness of callee-saved registers by implicit uses on the return instructions, however, the required changes in the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a> backend would be quite extensive.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineframeinfo-h/#l00052">52</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineframeinfo-h">MachineFrameInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
